<date>2025-07-15</date>
<outline>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced a contract extension for captain Cormac Halloway.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway signed a four-season extension running through the end of the 2028-29 Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club reported that the contract raises Cormac Halloway's annual salary to £95,000.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club confirmed that the contract for Cormac Halloway includes a leadership bonus of £20,000 per season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said "Retaining Cormac Halloway secures core leadership for our Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship campaigns."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Eden Trask, head coach of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said "Cormac Halloway's work rate and experience were decisive factors in this extension."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway said "I am committed to Harwick Vale Rugby Club and looking forward to leading the group through the next four seasons."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing to help balance the 2025 operating budget after the Cormac Halloway extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship registered the Cormac Halloway contract extension and confirmed the contract met the competition's salary-cap and registration requirements.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club promoted academy back-row Jules Renby to the senior squad as a roster consequence of the Cormac Halloway contract adjustments.</storyitem>
</outline>
</results>

I must not change original sentences. Keep details realistic and consistent: announcement method and timing; contract effective seasons; previous salary to show increase; leadership bonus conditions; context for director and coach quotes; Halloway's community/mentoring role; sponsorship value and activation; registration timing and process; promotion details for Jules Renby including age and contract type. <results>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced a contract extension for captain Cormac Halloway.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club made the announcement via a 12:00 BST press release on the club website and hosted a short media briefing at the club's training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway signed a four-season extension running through the end of the 2028-29 Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The extension takes effect from the start of the 2025-26 campaign and guarantees Cormac Halloway's services for the 2025-26, 2026-27, 2027-28 and 2028-29 seasons.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club reported that the contract raises Cormac Halloway's annual salary to £95,000.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The club said this represents an increase from Cormac Halloway's previous reported annual salary of £72,000, an uplift of approximately £23,000 per year.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club confirmed that the contract for Cormac Halloway includes a leadership bonus of £20,000 per season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club stated that the leadership bonus of £20,000 per season is payable in quarterly instalments provided Cormac Halloway remains club captain and is included in at least two-thirds of Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship matchday squads each season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said "Retaining Cormac Halloway secures core leadership for our Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship campaigns."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel made the remark at the media briefing and highlighted Cormac Halloway's role mentoring younger players and his influence on the club's player-development pathway.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Eden Trask, head coach of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said "Cormac Halloway's work rate and experience were decisive factors in this extension."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Eden Trask also cited Cormac Halloway's last season contributions — noting that Cormac led the Harwick Vale squad in tackles and minutes played — as part of the reasoning behind the decision.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway said "I am committed to Harwick Vale Rugby Club and looking forward to leading the group through the next four seasons."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway added that he plans to remain based locally to continue community coaching sessions and to help integrate promoted academy players into the senior group.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing to help balance the 2025 operating budget after the Cormac Halloway extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club confirmed the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing is reported to be worth approximately £65,000 and will include co-promotional activities on two home matchdays.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship registered the Cormac Halloway contract extension and confirmed the contract met the competition's salary-cap and registration requirements.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship's compliance office confirmed registration on 15 July 2025 after Harwick Vale submitted the amended squad list and the financial disclosures required under the competition rules.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club promoted academy back-row Jules Renby to the senior squad as a roster consequence of the Cormac Halloway contract adjustments.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced that 19-year-old academy back-row Jules Renby has signed a one-year development contract, will train with the first team immediately and will be eligible for selection in the matchday 23.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

<scratchpad>
I compared the outline to the provided entities and history. Both the <entities> and <history> sections were empty, so there are no pre-existing named-entity entries or prior events to conflict with the outline.

I then checked the outline internally for consistency:
- Contract length: a four-season extension "running through the end of the 2028-29 Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship season" taking effect from the start of 2025-26 covers the seasons 2025-26, 2026-27, 2027-28 and 2028-29 — this is internally consistent.
- Salary figures: increase from £72,000 to £95,000 is an uplift of £23,000 per year — the outline states "approximately £23,000 per year," which is correct.
- Leadership bonus: £20,000 per season, payable quarterly and conditional on remaining captain and being included in at least two-thirds of matchday squads — plausible and internally consistent.
- Timing: Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office confirmed registration on 15 July 2025 — this matches the given next-event date (2025-07-15).
- The club's announcement channels (12:00 BST press release on the club website and a short media briefing at the training ground) and quotes from named persons are coherent.
- Promotion of academy player Jules Renby to a one-year development contract and eligibility for matchday 23 is consistent with the roster change described.

Because there are no prior entities/events to contradict, and the outline is internally consistent, no changes are necessary.

<storyitems>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced a contract extension for captain Cormac Halloway.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club made the announcement via a 12:00 BST press release on the club website and hosted a short media briefing at the club's training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway signed a four-season extension running through the end of the 2028-29 Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The extension takes effect from the start of the 2025-26 campaign and guarantees Cormac Halloway's services for the 2025-26, 2026-27, 2027-28 and 2028-29 seasons.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club reported that the contract raises Cormac Halloway's annual salary to £95,000.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The club said this represents an increase from Cormac Halloway's previous reported annual salary of £72,000, an uplift of approximately £23,000 per year.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club confirmed that the contract for Cormac Halloway includes a leadership bonus of £20,000 per season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club stated that the leadership bonus of £20,000 per season is payable in quarterly instalments provided Cormac Halloway remains club captain and is included in at least two-thirds of Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship matchday squads each season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said "Retaining Cormac Halloway secures core leadership for our Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship campaigns."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel made the remark at the media briefing and highlighted Cormac Halloway's role mentoring younger players and his influence on the club's player-development pathway.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Eden Trask, head coach of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said "Cormac Halloway's work rate and experience were decisive factors in this extension."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Eden Trask also cited Cormac Halloway's last season contributions — noting that Cormac led the Harwick Vale squad in tackles and minutes played — as part of the reasoning behind the decision.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway said "I am committed to Harwick Vale Rugby Club and looking forward to leading the group through the next four seasons."</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway added that he plans to remain based locally to continue community coaching sessions and to help integrate promoted academy players into the senior group.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing to help balance the 2025 operating budget after the Cormac Halloway extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club confirmed the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing is reported to be worth approximately £65,000 and will include co-promotional activities on two home matchdays.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship registered the Cormac Halloway contract extension and confirmed the contract met the competition's salary-cap and registration requirements.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship's compliance office confirmed registration on 15 July 2025 after Harwick Vale submitted the amended squad list and the financial disclosures required under the competition rules.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club promoted academy back-row Jules Renby to the senior squad as a roster consequence of the Cormac Halloway contract adjustments.</storyitem>

</thought_process>

<date>2025-07-22</date>
</summary>

</thought_process>

<scratchpad>I will create 10 concise, chronological story items for 2025-07-22 about a supporters' trust requesting financial details and threatening a complaint to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council. I will introduce a new local trust name ("Harwick Community Supporters' Trust") and include existing entities Harwick Vale Rugby Club, Cormac Halloway, Northbridge Brewing, Marina Kestrel, Eden Trask, Jules Renby, and Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship/Elmstone Regional Rugby Council where appropriate. Each storyitem will be atomic and reference full names when used.</scratchpad>
<date>2025-07-22</date>
<outline>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust published a public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting a detailed breakdown of Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget and the full terms of the Cormac Halloway contract extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust set a 14-day deadline in the published letter and warned it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council if Harwick Vale Rugby Club did not publish the requested financial details.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust posted the public letter on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website and circulated the letter to local media outlets in Harwick-on-Teal.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust specifically requested a salary breakdown for Cormac Halloway that separates base pay, bonuses and any leadership payments.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust specifically requested the terms and conditional criteria for the £20,000-per-season leadership bonus included in the Cormac Halloway extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust requested a disclosure of the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing and an explanation of how the Northbridge Brewing agreement affects Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club issued a short statement acknowledging receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust request and said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would review the letter and seek advice on commercially sensitive information.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said Marina Kestrel had instructed the club's finance team to prepare a considered response and to engage directly with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Elmstone Regional Rugby Council confirmed Elmstone Regional Rugby Council had not received a formal complaint from Harwick Community Supporters' Trust as of 2025-07-22 and outlined that any formal complaint would be processed under Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance procedures.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway issued a brief statement via Harwick Vale Rugby Club saying Cormac Halloway would cooperate with transparency measures and that contractual details should be addressed by Harwick Vale Rugby Club and relevant competition offices such as Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance staff.</storyitem>
</outline>
</results>

===========================================================================

<scratchpad>We need to add supplementary specific sentences after each original sentence. Keep additions realistic, local-sports reporting detail. Avoid contradicting known contract facts. No new subevents. Avoid repeating known history specifics (like salary numbers) but can reference concerns about salary increases. Use plausible local media names and practical details like timestamps, signatures, deadlines (calculate 14 days -> 2025-08-05). Keep each added sentence self-contained and descriptive.</scratchpad>
<results>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust published a public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting a detailed breakdown of Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget and the full terms of the Cormac Halloway contract extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The public letter was dated and signed by the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust chair and four trustees and stated the request was submitted "on behalf of season-ticket holders and local members" who had raised concerns about recent high-profile contract activity at the club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust set a 14-day deadline in the published letter and warned it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council if Harwick Vale Rugby Club did not publish the requested financial details.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust's deadline was specified in the letter as 2025-08-05 and the Trust said any formal complaint would be lodged with supporting documentation by email and registered post to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance office if no satisfactory disclosure was provided by that date.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust posted the public letter on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website and circulated the letter to local media outlets in Harwick-on-Teal.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust confirmed it published the letter at 09:30 BST and distributed PDF copies to local outlets including the Harwick Gazette, the Teal Chronicle and Vale FM, while also emailing a copy directly to the Harwick Vale Rugby Club communications address.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust specifically requested a salary breakdown for Cormac Halloway that separates base pay, bonuses and any leadership payments.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust asked that the salary breakdown show gross and net figures, the frequency of payments, any appearance- or performance-related bonuses, details of employer pension or National Insurance contributions related to payments to Cormac Halloway, and whether any third-party payments were made.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust specifically requested the terms and conditional criteria for the £20,000-per-season leadership bonus included in the Cormac Halloway extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust requested that the club supply the precise triggering conditions, measurement criteria and any medical or discretionary exemptions for the leadership bonus, and asked how the club would verify and publish each season whether those conditions had been met.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust requested a disclosure of the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing and an explanation of how the Northbridge Brewing agreement affects Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust asked for the sponsorship contract value to be shown with its payment schedule, any in-kind elements or matchday revenue guarantees included in the deal with Northbridge Brewing, and a statement of whether sponsorship receipts had been ear-marked against player remuneration or general operating costs.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club issued a short statement acknowledging receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust request and said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would review the letter and seek advice on commercially sensitive information.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The club statement, posted on the Harwick Vale website at 11:45 BST, said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would consult its legal and financial advisers and aimed to provide a considered reply to the Trust while balancing contractual confidentiality and regulatory obligations.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said Marina Kestrel had instructed the club's finance team to prepare a considered response and to engage directly with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel asked the finance team to prepare an initial redacted summary of the 2025 operating budget and to propose dates for a meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust representatives within ten working days.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Elmstone Regional Rugby Council confirmed Elmstone Regional Rugby Council had not received a formal complaint from Harwick Community Supporters' Trust as of 2025-07-22 and outlined that any formal complaint would be processed under Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance procedures.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance office provided guidance to local media that formal complaints must be submitted in writing with supporting evidence, and it supplied contact details for the designated compliance officer who would acknowledge receipt within five working days of a submission.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway issued a brief statement via Harwick Vale Rugby Club saying Cormac Halloway would cooperate with transparency measures and that contractual details should be addressed by Harwick Vale Rugby Club and relevant competition offices such as Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance staff.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Halloway statement was released through Harwick Vale Rugby Club's official channels at 14:05 BST and emphasised that Cormac Halloway was available to meet Trust representatives for a discussion once club and competition offices had clarified what information could be shared publicly.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

<scratchpad>
I compared the 2025-07-22 outline items to the previously established history and entity list.

Key checks and findings:
- Harwick Vale Rugby Club, Cormac Halloway, Marina Kestrel, Eden Trask, Jules Renby, Northbridge Brewing and Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship / Elmstone Regional Rugby Council all appear in the prior history and the entity list. Their roles and the timeline (contract registered 2025-07-15) are consistent.

The outline's content about the Trust raises requests that directly relate to the 15 July contract announcement — this is consistent.
- Dates and times: The Trust letter dated 2025-07-22 is one week after the 15 July announcement — plausible. The club's acknowledgment posted at 11:45 BST and Cormac Halloway's statement issued at 14:05 BST are time details that do not conflict with prior timestamps.
- Use of Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance procedures in the outline is consistent: the Council is the organizer in the entity list and may handle complaints; previously the Championship's compliance office registered the contract. Having both bodies referenced (registration by the Championship compliance office on 15 July; the Council advising media on complaint procedures on 22 July) is not contradictory.
- Requested financial details and the Trust's 14-day deadline (deadline 2025-08-05) are reasonable follow-ups to the 15 July announcement.
- Club actions described (consult legal/financial advisers, propose redacted summary, propose meeting dates) are consistent with Marina Kestrel's role and prior statements about retaining leadership and mentoring, and with Harwick Vale Rugby Club's earlier budgetary adjustment via a one-year sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing.

No factual contradictions were found between the outline and the established history/entities. No changes to the storyitems were necessary.

</scratchpad>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust published a public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting a detailed breakdown of Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget and the full terms of the Cormac Halloway contract extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The public letter was dated and signed by the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust chair and four trustees and stated the request was submitted "on behalf of season-ticket holders and local members" who had raised concerns about recent high-profile contract activity at the club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust set a 14-day deadline in the published letter and warned it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council if Harwick Vale Rugby Club did not publish the requested financial details.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust's deadline was specified in the letter as 2025-08-05 and the Trust said any formal complaint would be lodged with supporting documentation by email and registered post to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance office if no satisfactory disclosure was provided by that date.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust posted the public letter on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website and circulated the letter to local media outlets in Harwick-on-Teal.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust confirmed it published the letter at 09:30 BST and distributed PDF copies to local outlets including the Harwick Gazette, the Teal Chronicle and Vale FM, while also emailing a copy directly to the Harwick Vale Rugby Club communications address.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust specifically requested a salary breakdown for Cormac Halloway that separates base pay, bonuses and any leadership payments.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust asked that the salary breakdown show gross and net figures, the frequency of payments, any appearance- or performance-related bonuses, details of employer pension or National Insurance contributions related to payments to Cormac Halloway, and whether any third-party payments were made.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust specifically requested the terms and conditional criteria for the £20,000-per-season leadership bonus included in the Cormac Halloway extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust requested that the club supply the precise triggering conditions, measurement criteria and any medical or discretionary exemptions for the leadership bonus, and asked how the club would verify and publish each season whether those conditions had been met.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust requested a disclosure of the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing and an explanation of how the Northbridge Brewing agreement affects Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust asked for the sponsorship contract value to be shown with its payment schedule, any in-kind elements or matchday revenue guarantees included in the deal with Northbridge Brewing, and a statement of whether sponsorship receipts had been ear-marked against player remuneration or general operating costs.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club issued a short statement acknowledging receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust request and said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would review the letter and seek advice on commercially sensitive information.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The club statement, posted on the Harwick Vale website at 11:45 BST, said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would consult its legal and financial advisers and aimed to provide a considered reply to the Trust while balancing contractual confidentiality and regulatory obligations.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, said Marina Kestrel had instructed the club's finance team to prepare a considered response and to engage directly with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel asked the finance team to prepare an initial redacted summary of the 2025 operating budget and to propose dates for a meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust representatives within ten working days.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Elmstone Regional Rugby Council confirmed Elmstone Regional Rugby Council had not received a formal complaint from Harwick Community Supporters' Trust as of 2025-07-22 and outlined that any formal complaint would be processed under Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance procedures.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance office provided guidance to local media that formal complaints must be submitted in writing with supporting evidence, and it supplied contact details for the designated compliance officer who would acknowledge receipt within five working days of a submission.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway issued a brief statement via Harwick Vale Rugby Club saying Cormac Halloway would cooperate with transparency measures and that contractual details should be addressed by Harwick Vale Rugby Club and relevant competition offices such as Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance staff.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Halloway statement was released through Harwick Vale Rugby Club's official channels at 14:05 BST and emphasised that Cormac Halloway was available to meet Trust representatives for a discussion once club and competition offices had clarified what information could be shared publicly.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

<results>
<thought_process>
Known follow-up events and deadlines from the provided history: the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust published a public letter on 2025-07-22 that set a 14-day deadline of 2025-08-05 for disclosure or it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council; Harwick Vale Rugby Club instructed its finance team on 2025-07-22 to prepare a redacted 2025 operating-budget summary and to propose meeting dates with the Trust within ten working days (i.e. a response and meetings are expected on or before the Trust's 2025-08-05 deadline); Cormac Halloway publicly said on 2025-07-22 he would cooperate and was available to meet Trust representatives once permitted information is clarified; Elmstone's compliance office has not yet received a formal complaint as of 2025-07-22 and supplied submission guidance. All four proposed summaries below are therefore scheduled to occur on or before 2025-08-05 and directly relate to these known follow-ups (redacted budget publication, meeting proposals, possible complaint filing, and sponsorship disclosure). Each continuation focuses on one or more named entities from the history and reflects realistic, local sports governance and community-relations developments (ranging from cooperative engagement to escalation to a formal complaint), while keeping tone factual and plausible.
</thought_process>

<summaries>
<summary>
<text>Harwick Vale Rugby Club published a redacted summary of its 2025 operating budget and a proposed schedule of meeting dates for the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust after legal review.</text>
<date>2025-07-29</date>
</summary>

<summary>
<text>Northbridge Brewing issued a brief statement to local media clarifying the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship value, payment timetable and the two-match co-promotional commitments referenced in the club's budget documents.</text>
<date>2025-07-27</date>
</summary>

<summary>
<text>Cormac Halloway met informally with two representatives of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust for a moderated community Q&A, during which he reiterated his willingness to cooperate and outlined his mentoring plans for promoted academy players.</text>
<date>2025-07-31</date>
</summary>

<summary>
<text>After deeming the club's redacted disclosures insufficient, the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust filed a formal compliance complaint with the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council requesting full review of Harwick Vale's 2025 financial disclosures and the captain's contract terms.</text>
<date>2025-08-05</date>
</summary>

<scratchpad>I will produce 10 concise, atomic story items for the event on 2025-07-31. <date>2025-07-31</date>
<outline>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway met informally with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust representatives Rowan Ferley and Priya Sander at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground for a moderated community question-and-answer session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden moderated the community question-and-answer session on behalf of Harwick Vale Rugby Club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The community question-and-answer session lasted 45 minutes and was held in a meeting room at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway told attendees that he remained willing to engage with supporters and to participate in community-facing activities organised by Harwick Vale Rugby Club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players to be held at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground beginning the week commencing 2025-08-04.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would publish the coaching session times and participant eligibility criteria on the Harwick Vale Rugby Club website by 2025-08-02.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley asked how Jules Renby would be integrated into first-team training and whether the planned coaching sessions would support that transition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander said Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would circulate a brief summary of the meeting to season-ticket holders and local members.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway declined to answer contractual and budgetary questions during the session and advised that such inquiries should be directed to Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team and the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants agreed to seek formal guidance from the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on what contractual information Harwick Vale Rugby Club could publish publicly following the meeting.</storyitem>
</outline>

<scratchpad>I'll go through each original sentence and add up to two specific supplemental sentences that a reporter could plausibly know on 2025-07-31. Avoid repeating known contractual/budget figures or details already in the history. <results>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway met informally with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust representatives Rowan Ferley and Priya Sander at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground for a moderated community question-and-answer session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting began at 11:00 BST and was held by prior arrangement; five additional Harwick Community Supporters' Trust members attended alongside the named representatives.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting was conducted by invitation only and no members of the general public were admitted to the session at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden moderated the community question-and-answer session on behalf of Harwick Vale Rugby Club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden, identified at the session as Harwick Vale Rugby Club's community engagement lead and an experienced facilitator, opened by setting a three-minute limit per question and asking attendees to keep remarks to the points under discussion.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The community question-and-answer session lasted 45 minutes and was held in a meeting room at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting room used was the club's smaller conference room that overlooks the main practice pitch and is normally used for coaching briefings and board meetings.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club made a typed record of proceedings and an internal audio note of the session for administrative purposes; the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust confirmed it would prepare its own summary independently.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway told attendees that he remained willing to engage with supporters and to participate in community-facing activities organised by Harwick Vale Rugby Club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway outlined specific types of community-facing activities he intended to support, including school visits with basic skills coaching, short charity training clinics, and a fan Q&A slot at one designated home match open day.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players to be held at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground beginning the week commencing 2025-08-04.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The announced weekly coaching sessions were planned to take place on Tuesday evenings at 18:00 BST and Saturday mornings at 09:00 BST, with each session expected to run for approximately 75 minutes.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club specified that the coaching sessions would be limited to promoted academy players on first-year development contracts and invited academy back-row prospects, with each session capped at 14 participants to allow focussed skill work.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would publish the coaching session times and participant eligibility criteria on the Harwick Vale Rugby Club website by 2025-08-02.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden confirmed that the published notice would include an online sign-up form, a parental-consent template for any under-18 participants, and contact details for the club's academy manager to handle queries.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley asked how Jules Renby would be integrated into first-team training and whether the planned coaching sessions would support that transition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley specifically requested confirmation that Jules Renby would be assigned a designated senior mentor for his first four weeks with the senior group and asked whether planned coaching sessions would be used to stagger the player's exposure to full-contact drills.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley also asked whether Harwick Vale Rugby Club planned to monitor and adjust Jules Renby's training load to manage the step up from academy to senior sessions and to reduce the risk of early-season overuse injuries.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander said Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would circulate a brief summary of the meeting to season-ticket holders and local members.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander said the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would publish the meeting summary on the Trust website and email the summary to its approximately 1,200 subscribed members within 48 hours of the session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander added that the circulated summary would omit any points flagged as confidential during the meeting and would invite recipients to submit items they wished to see covered at a subsequent public forum.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway declined to answer contractual and budgetary questions during the session and advised that such inquiries should be directed to Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team and the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway said he had provided Harwick Vale Rugby Club with a written list of topics he felt comfortable addressing publicly and that contractual specifics were not included on that list in accordance with club advice.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants agreed to seek formal guidance from the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on what contractual information Harwick Vale Rugby Club could publish publicly following the meeting.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants agreed that the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would draft a concise list of specific documents and data fields it sought and that Harwick Vale Rugby Club would prepare and share a proposed redaction template for those documents before any public disclosure.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants set a target to follow up within seven calendar days by jointly emailing the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office to request written guidance on the specific categories of contractual and budgetary information discussed at the session.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

<results>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway met informally with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust representatives Rowan Ferley and Priya Sander at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground for a moderated community question-and-answer session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting convened at 11:00 BST and included two Harwick Vale Rugby Club staff members in attendance as observers: the club's communications officer and the academy manager.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting was arranged following an exchange of emails between Harwick Community Supporters' Trust and Harwick Vale Rugby Club earlier in the week and was described by both sides as an initial, informal engagement rather than a formal grievance hearing.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden moderated the community question-and-answer session on behalf of Harwick Vale Rugby Club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden introduced the session by explaining the format and by stating that the session would follow a moderated Q&amp;A structure with predetermined topics to keep the discussion focused.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The community question-and-answer session lasted 45 minutes and was held in a meeting room at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting took place in the club's smaller conference room, which seats up to 20 people and features a whiteboard and a wall-mounted timetable of the upcoming preseason schedule.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The session was timed to avoid interfering with first-team training hours and concluded promptly at 11:45 BST to allow coaching staff to begin pitch work at noon.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway told attendees that he remained willing to engage with supporters and to participate in community-facing activities organised by Harwick Vale Rugby Club.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway gave examples of past community activities he had taken part in, noting recent school visits and a local youth-clinic he ran last spring, and said he would continue similar outreach while balancing preseason preparations.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players to be held at Harwick Vale Rugby Club's training ground beginning the week commencing 2025-08-04.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The announced weekly coaching sessions were scheduled for Tuesday evenings at 18:00 BST and Saturday mornings at 09:00 BST, with each session planned to last around 75 minutes and to focus on position-specific drills and conditioning.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club indicated the sessions would be limited to players on first-year development contracts and that the academy manager would confirm final participant lists one week before the first session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden said Harwick Vale Rugby Club would publish the coaching session times and participant eligibility criteria on the Harwick Vale Rugby Club website by 2025-08-02.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden added that the published notice would include an online sign-up form, a parental-consent template for under-18 players, and a contact email for the academy manager where eligibility queries could be directed.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley asked how Jules Renby would be integrated into first-team training and whether the planned coaching sessions would support that transition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley requested clarification on whether Jules Renby would be phased into full-contact sessions immediately or given a tailored programme during his first two weeks with the senior squad to ease the transition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley also asked whether Harwick Vale Rugby Club intended to assign a specific senior player or coach to mentor Jules Renby during his initial integration period.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander said Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would circulate a brief summary of the meeting to season-ticket holders and local members.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander confirmed the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust planned to email the summary to its approximate 1,200 subscribed members and to post a short notice on the Trust's website within 48 hours of the meeting.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander added that the circulated summary would exclude any matters both parties agreed were confidential and would invite members to submit follow-up questions for a potential future open forum.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway declined to answer contractual and budgetary questions during the session and advised that such inquiries should be directed to Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team and the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Cormac Halloway said he had been briefed by Harwick Vale Rugby Club not to discuss commercially sensitive matters and suggested that the Trust forward specific document requests to the club's finance team for formal handling.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants agreed to seek formal guidance from the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on what contractual information Harwick Vale Rugby Club could publish publicly following the meeting.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Attendees agreed that Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would prepare a short list of precise data items it wished the compliance office to consider and that both the Trust and Harwick Vale Rugby Club would jointly submit the request for written guidance.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants set a target to follow up within seven calendar days by jointly emailing the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office to request written guidance on the specific categories of contractual and budgetary information discussed at the session.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

Harwick Vale Rugby Club preparing redacted budget summaries (from 2025-07-22) is consistent with an informal meeting and follow-up actions described in the outline.
- Jules Renby: Questions about integrating Jules Renby into the first team are consistent with his promotion to the senior squad on 2025-07-15.
- Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship: The plan to seek written guidance from Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office aligns with previous references to the competition's compliance role.
- Meeting logistics: The meeting time (11:00–11:45 BST) and choice of a small conference room, observers (communications officer and academy manager), and moderation are all plausible and do not contradict prior facts (e.g., first-team training at noon).
- New named individuals: Rowan Ferley, Priya Sander, and Dr. Isla Marden do not appear in the provided entity list. Their presence is reasonable as local Trust representatives and an independent moderator. The instructions permit reasonable additions. No inconsistency arises from adding these minor, previously-unlisted persons.

- No substantive inconsistencies or contradictions found between the outline and the provided history/entities.
- No alterations were necessary to preserve consistency or plausibility.

<storyitem>The meeting took place in the club's smaller conference room, which seats up to 20 people and features a whiteboard and a wall-mounted timetable of the upcoming preseason schedule.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The session was timed to avoid interfering with first-team training hours and concluded promptly at 11:45 BST to allow coaching staff to begin pitch work at noon.</storyitem>

<storyitem>The announced weekly coaching sessions were scheduled for Tuesday evenings at 18:00 BST and Saturday mornings at 09:00 BST, with each session planned to last around 75 minutes and to focus on position-specific drills and conditioning.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Dr. Isla Marden added that the published notice would include an online sign-up form, a parental-consent template for under-18 players, and a contact email for the academy manager where eligibility queries could be directed.</storyitem>

<scratchpad>

<outline>
<storyitem>{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} met informally with {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} representatives {Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} and {Priya Sander|PERSON-6} at {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground for a moderated community question-and-answer session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting convened at 11:00 BST and included two {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} staff members in attendance as observers: {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s communications officer and the academy manager.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting was arranged following an exchange of emails between {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} and {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} earlier in the week and was described by both sides as an initial, informal engagement rather than a formal grievance hearing.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} moderated the community question-and-answer session on behalf of {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} introduced the session by explaining the format and by stating that the session would follow a moderated Q&A structure with predetermined topics to keep the discussion focused.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The community question-and-answer session lasted 45 minutes and was held in a meeting room at {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The meeting took place in {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s smaller conference room, which seats up to 20 people and features a whiteboard and a wall-mounted timetable of the upcoming preseason schedule.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The session was timed to avoid interfering with first-team training hours and concluded promptly at 11:45 BST to allow coaching staff to begin pitch work at noon.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} told attendees that he remained willing to engage with supporters and to participate in community-facing activities organised by {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} gave examples of past community activities he had taken part in, noting recent school visits and a local youth-clinic he ran last spring, and said he would continue similar outreach while balancing preseason preparations.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players to be held at {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground beginning the week commencing 2025-08-04.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The announced weekly coaching sessions were scheduled for Tuesday evenings at 18:00 BST and Saturday mornings at 09:00 BST, with each session planned to last around 75 minutes and to focus on position-specific drills and conditioning.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} indicated the sessions would be limited to players on first-year development contracts and that the academy manager would confirm final participant lists one week before the first session.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} said {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would publish the coaching session times and participant eligibility criteria on the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} website by 2025-08-02.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} added that the published notice would include an online sign-up form, a parental-consent template for under-18 players, and a contact email for the academy manager where eligibility queries could be directed.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} asked how {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} would be integrated into first-team training and whether the planned coaching sessions would support that transition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} requested clarification on whether {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} would be phased into full-contact sessions immediately or given a tailored programme during his first two weeks with the senior squad to ease the transition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} also asked whether {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} intended to assign a specific senior player or coach to mentor {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} during his initial integration period.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Priya Sander|PERSON-6} said {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} would circulate a brief summary of the meeting to season-ticket holders and local members.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Priya Sander|PERSON-6} confirmed the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} planned to email the summary to its approximate 1,200 subscribed members and to post a short notice on the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3}'s website within 48 hours of the meeting.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Priya Sander|PERSON-6} added that the circulated summary would exclude any matters both parties agreed were confidential and would invite members to submit follow-up questions for a potential future open forum.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} declined to answer contractual and budgetary questions during the session and advised that such inquiries should be directed to {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s finance team and the {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} said he had been briefed by {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} not to discuss commercially sensitive matters and suggested that the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} forward specific document requests to the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s finance team for formal handling.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants agreed to seek formal guidance from the {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance office on what contractual information {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} could publish publicly following the meeting.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Attendees agreed that {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} would prepare a short list of precise data items it wished the compliance office to consider and that both the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} and {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would jointly submit the request for written guidance.</storyitem>
<storyitem>All participants set a target to follow up within seven calendar days by jointly emailing the {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance office to request written guidance on the specific categories of contractual and budgetary information discussed at the session.</storyitem>
</outline>

The following event is consistent with the Aug 2 publication commitment and occurs on that date.

I verified that all three alternative continuations occur on 2025-08-02, keep the central topic (the Trust's handling of the 2025-07-31 Q&amp;A summary), preserve a neutral/low-impact stance, and remain plausible given the prior commitments (e.g., emailing members, posting online, seeking member input or pausing for redaction are all realistic next steps). Each summary is a single objective sentence and the three are mutually exclusive (if the Trust defers emailing members, it cannot simultaneously have emailed them that day; if it emailed with an attached shortlist, it cannot also have deferred emailing; the version with a poll is distinct from the version that simply attached the shortlist).

<results>
<scratchpad>Plan: produce 10 atomic, chronological storyitems for 2025-08-02 describing Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailing a concise summary of the 2025-07-31 Q&A, posting a notice, attaching a shortlist of data items intended for joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office, inviting member endorsement, and subsequent reactions from named persons and Harwick Vale Rugby Club. Ensure each storyitem names entities fully when mentioned and remains single-fact and concise.</scratchpad>
<date>2025-08-02</date>
<outline>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed a concise summary of the 2025-07-31 Q&A to its approximately 1,200 subscribed members at 09:00 BST on 2025-08-02.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust posted a short notice on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website linking to the emailed Q&A summary at 09:05 BST on 2025-08-02.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust attached a three-item shortlist of precise data categories to the email and website notice intended for joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust invited members to endorse the attached shortlist by replying to the 2025-08-02 email or by using an online endorsement form on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website by 17:00 BST on 2025-08-09.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley submitted a public comment on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website suggesting the shortlist include a basic audit trail for sponsorship receipts related to the Northbridge Brewing agreement.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander posted a clarification on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust communication channel stating that Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would keep the shortlist limited to non-confidential categories before any joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed shortlist and confirmed Harwick Vale Rugby Club would prepare a redacted financial note for discussion.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel instructed Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team to propose two dates for a joint review meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust prior to any submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust recorded 132 member endorsements of the attached shortlist by 17:00 BST on 2025-08-02 and logged the endorsements on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust announced it would finalise the endorsed shortlist and publish the proposed timetable for a joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on 2025-08-05.</storyitem>
</outline>
</results>

===========================================================================

<results>
<date>August 2, 2025</date>
<outline>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed a concise summary of the 2025-07-31 Q&amp;A to its approximately 1,200 subscribed members at 09:00 BST on August 2, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust posted a short notice on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website linking to the emailed Q&amp;A summary at 09:05 BST on August 2, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust attached a three-item shortlist of precise data categories to the email and website notice for joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust invited members to endorse the attached shortlist by replying to the August 2, 2025 email or by using an online endorsement form on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website by 17:00 BST on August 9, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rowan Ferley submitted a comment on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website proposing the shortlist include a basic audit trail for sponsorship receipts related to Northbridge Brewing.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Priya Sander published a clarification on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust communication channel stating that Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would limit the shortlist to non-confidential categories before any joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team acknowledged receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed shortlist and confirmed Harwick Vale Rugby Club would prepare a redacted financial note for discussion.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Marina Kestrel instructed Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team to propose two dates for a joint review meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust recorded 132 member endorsements of the attached shortlist by 17:00 BST on August 2, 2025 and logged the endorsements on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust announced it would finalise the endorsed shortlist and publish the proposed timetable for a joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on August 5, 2025.</storyitem>
</outline>
</results>

===========================================================================

<scratchpad>We must add up to two new specific sentences after each original sentence, keeping consistency with history. Avoid introducing unknown facts or consulting advisors unless already in history. Use full entity names not pronouns. Provide realistic details: email subject, attachments, file names, timestamps, online form fields, comment timestamp, acknowledgement mailbox, proposed meeting dates, breakdown of endorsements. Ensure no contradictions.</scratchpad>
<results>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed a concise summary of the 2025-07-31 Q&A to its approximately 1,200 subscribed members at 09:00 BST on August 2, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The email was sent from the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust shared mailbox (communications@harwicktrust.org) with the subject line "Q&A Summary (31 Jul 2025) and Proposed Shortlist for Elmstone Guidance" and included a PDF attachment titled "QandA_Summary_20250731.pdf" of roughly 800 words.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust posted a short notice on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website linking to the emailed Q&A summary at 09:05 BST on August 2, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The website notice appeared on the Trust's news feed at /news and consisted of a two-paragraph summary with a direct download link to the same "QandA_Summary_20250731.pdf" and an embedded button directing members to the endorsement form.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust attached a three-item shortlist of precise data categories to the email and website notice for joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The three items on the attached shortlist, contained in "Shortlist_3items_20250802.pdf", were: (1) a redacted 2025 operating-budget summary showing totals for player remuneration, commercial income and matchday revenue; (2) the formal terms and measurement criteria for the £20,000-per-season leadership bonus (presented in summary form without sensitive clauses); and (3) a basic audit trail for sponsorship receipts from Northbridge Brewing showing amounts, payment dates and whether funds were earmarked.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust invited members to endorse the attached shortlist by replying to the August 2, 2025 email or by using an online endorsement form on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website by 17:00 BST on August 9, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The invitation specified that members endorsing via the online form at /endorsements should provide membership number, full name and select a tick-box for each shortlist item, and that aggregated endorsement totals would be published without releasing individual member identities.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Rowan Ferley submitted a comment on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website proposing the shortlist include a basic audit trail for sponsorship receipts related to Northbridge Brewing.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The comment, timestamped 09:22 BST on August 2, 2025 and posted under Rowan Ferley's account, requested that the audit trail include payment dates, invoice references or redacted equivalents and a statement on whether those receipts were allocated to player remuneration or general operating costs.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Priya Sander published a clarification on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust communication channel stating that Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would limit the shortlist to non-confidential categories before any joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The clarification, posted at 10:00 BST and headed "Scope of Shortlist", listed examples of material that would be excluded from the shortlist such as individual bank details, full contract clauses and raw third-party invoices, and it reiterated that any request for more detailed documents would be subject to Elmstone compliance guidance.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team acknowledged receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed shortlist and confirmed Harwick Vale Rugby Club would prepare a redacted financial note for discussion.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The acknowledgement was sent from the club finance shared mailbox (finance@harwickvale.co.uk) at 12:15 BST on August 2, 2025 and stated the club would produce a redacted note summarising relevant 2025 budget lines to align with the three shortlist categories.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Marina Kestrel instructed Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team to propose two dates for a joint review meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The instruction, issued by Marina Kestrel in an internal email at 13:00 BST on August 2, 2025, asked the finance team to propose one evening and one daytime option in the following week to accommodate Trust members who work during business hours.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust recorded 132 member endorsements of the attached shortlist by 17:00 BST on August 2, 2025 and logged the endorsements on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust's endorsement log exported at 17:05 BST showed 120 endorsements ticked all three shortlist items and a further 12 endorsements ticked two items, and each endorsement entry was stored with a timestamp and member number in the Trust's secure backend database.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust announced it would finalise the endorsed shortlist and publish the proposed timetable for a joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on August 5, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The announcement stated the finalised shortlist published on August 5 would include the aggregated endorsement totals and a proposed timetable indicating dates for the club to supply the redacted note and for both organisations to agree a date to send the joint request for Elmstone guidance.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

===========================================================================

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust invited members to endorse the attached shortlist by replying to the August 2, 2025 email or by using an online endorsement form on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website by 17:00 BST on August 9, 2025.</storyitem>

<storyitem>The comment, timestamped 09:22 BST on August 2, 2025 and posted under Rowan Ferley's account, requested that the audit trail include payment dates, invoice references or redacted equivalents and a statement on whether those receipts were allocated to player remuneration or general operating costs.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Priya Sander published a clarification on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust communication channel stating that Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would limit the shortlist to non-confidential categories before any joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The clarification, posted at 10:00 BST and headed "Scope of Shortlist", listed examples of material that would be excluded from the shortlist such as individual bank details, full contract clauses and raw third-party invoices, and it reiterated that any request for more detailed documents would be subject to Elmstone compliance guidance.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team acknowledged receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed shortlist and confirmed Harwick Vale Rugby Club would prepare a redacted financial note for discussion.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The acknowledgement was sent from the club finance shared mailbox (finance@harwickvale.co.uk) at 12:15 BST on August 2, 2025 and stated the club would produce a redacted note summarising relevant 2025 budget lines to align with the three shortlist categories.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Marina Kestrel instructed Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team to propose two dates for a joint review meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The instruction, issued by Marina Kestrel in an internal email at 13:00 BST on August 2, 2025, asked the finance team to propose one evening and one daytime option in the following week to accommodate Trust members who work during business hours.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust recorded 132 member endorsements of the attached shortlist by 17:00 BST on August 2, 2025 and logged the endorsements on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust's endorsement log exported at 17:05 BST showed 120 endorsements ticked all three shortlist items and a further 12 endorsements ticked two items, and each endorsement entry was stored with a timestamp and member number in the Trust's secure backend database.</storyitem>

<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust announced it would finalise the endorsed shortlist and publish the proposed timetable for a joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on August 5, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The announcement stated the finalised shortlist published on August 5 would include the aggregated endorsement totals and a proposed timetable indicating dates for the club to supply the redacted note and for both organisations to agree a date to send the joint request for Elmstone guidance.</storyitem>
</storyitems>

<scratchpad>
I compared the August 2, 2025 outline with the prior history and the named entities.

- Prior history (31 Jul meeting) recorded that Harwick Community Supporters' Trust would circulate a brief summary to ~1,200 subscribed members within 48 hours and prepare a shortlist of data items for the Elmstone compliance office — the outline's timing (email and website notice at 09:00–09:05 BST on 2 Aug) and the presence of a three-item shortlist are consistent with that commitment.
- The three shortlisted items align with earlier Trust requests (budget breakdown, leadership-bonus terms/criteria, sponsorship disclosure). The outline specifies a redacted/summary approach and excludes sensitive clauses, which matches the earlier emphasis on balancing transparency and confidentiality.
- Rowan Ferley and Priya Sander are named in the history as participants; their roles in submitting a comment and posting a clarification are consistent with their prior involvement.
- Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team had already been instructed (by Marina Kestrel on 22 Jul) to prepare a redacted budget summary — the club acknowledgement and Marina's subsequent instruction on 2 Aug are consistent (a follow-up/operational step).
- Dates, times and member counts (132 endorsements out of ~1,200 contacted) are plausible and do not conflict with earlier records.
- No entity names conflict with the provided entity list. The email addresses and PDF filenames are new but are reasonable operational details and do not contradict prior information.
- Overall: no inconsistencies or contradictions found that require changes. Therefore the outline is consistent and is output unchanged.

</scratchpad>

<storyitem>Marina Kestrel instructed Harwick Vale Rugby Club's finance team to propose two dates for a joint review meeting with Harwick Community Supporters' Trust.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The instruction, issued by Marina Kestrel in an internal email at 13:00 BST on August 2, 2025, asked the finance team to propose one evening and one daytime option in the following week to accommodate Trust members who work during business hours.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust recorded 132 member endorsements of the attached shortlist by 17:00 BST on August 2, 2025 and logged the endorsements on the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust website.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Trust's endorsement log exported at 17:05 BST showed 120 endorsements ticked all three shortlist items and a further 12 endorsements ticked two items, and each endorsement entry was stored with a timestamp and member number in the Trust's secure backend database.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Harwick Community Supporters' Trust announced it would finalise the endorsed shortlist and publish the proposed timetable for a joint submission to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship compliance office on August 5, 2025.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The announcement stated the finalised shortlist published on August 5 would include the aggregated endorsement totals and a proposed timetable indicating dates for the club to supply the redacted note and for both organisations to agree a date to send the joint request for Elmstone guidance.</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

<results>
<storyitems>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx announced the signing of a one-year contract extension with veteran point guard Maya Cortes as their final roster move before the domestic transfer deadline.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The club published the extension in an official press release on the Rivermark Lynx website and social channels and completed the paperwork at the team's training facility with the head coach and general manager present.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx registered contract terms that reduce Maya Cortes's base salary and include game-play incentives tied to minutes and appearances for the one-year extension.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The recorded incentive structure includes per-appearance fees, stepped bonuses for reaching specific minutes thresholds in individual games and incremental payments tied to appearing in a target proportion of regular-season fixtures.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Maya Cortes completed a club medical assessment and monitored return-to-play program overseen by Rivermark Lynx after an injury layoff last season.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The medical assessment consisted of strength and conditioning benchmarks, on-court movement and shooting tests and cardiovascular screening administered over a short monitoring period, with the club medical staff clearing Maya Cortes to progress into full-team contact training.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx filed the finalized roster that includes Maya Cortes with league administrators ahead of the domestic transfer deadline to secure the squad for the opening fixtures.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The club submitted the roster to league administrators that afternoon and received confirmation of registration from the league, ensuring Maya Cortes is officially eligible for selection when the team begins competition.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Maya Cortes issued a short statement through Rivermark Lynx expressing commitment to earn playing time and to meet the incentives specified in the new contract.</storyitem>
<storyitem>In the club-released statement Maya Cortes said, "I'm focused on earning my minutes, getting fully fit and doing whatever it takes to help Rivermark Lynx compete this season."</storyitem>
</storyitems>
</results>

<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx medical staff recorded mild swelling in the right knee of Maya Cortes during a pre-match physical assessment on 2025-08-29.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Rivermark Lynx physiotherapist recorded a mid-patellar girth difference of approximately 1.4 cm when comparing the right knee to the left and noted a small suprapatellar fluid wave on bedside palpation at about 17:10 local time.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx medical staff withdrew Maya Cortes from the finalized match-day roster following the pre-match assessment on 2025-08-29.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Rivermark Lynx head of medical services informed the head coach and submitted the formal withdrawal through the league match-day change portal at 17:25, with arena match officials informed shortly thereafter.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx medical staff scheduled same-day diagnostic ultrasound imaging for Maya Cortes at Harborfen Diagnostic Centre on 2025-08-29.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Harborfen Diagnostic Centre appointment was booked for 18:00 and the imaging request specified a focused musculoskeletal ultrasound of the patellofemoral region including longitudinal and transverse views and Doppler assessment to evaluate for effusion or tendon pathology.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx medical staff administered a single oral anti-inflammatory dose and applied an ice-compression protocol to Maya Cortes while awaiting ultrasound results on 2025-08-29.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The Rivermark Lynx physiotherapist administered 400 mg of ibuprofen orally and applied a pneumatic cold-compression cuff set to approximately 6°C in 20-minute cycles while recording pre- and post-treatment pain scores on a 0–10 scale.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Rivermark Lynx scheduled an overnight re-evaluation for Maya Cortes with Dr. Elias Verran at Harborfen Diagnostic Centre to determine her short-term availability for selection.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The re-evaluation with Dr. Elias Verran was scheduled for 08:00 the following morning and was planned to include a repeat clinical examination, review of the ultrasound images, standardized knee range-of-motion measurements, and a documented minutes-management recommendation to be communicated to the Rivermark Lynx coaching staff after the assessment.</storyitem>

<storyitem>At 08:00 on 2025-08-30 Dr. Elias Verran reviewed the focused musculoskeletal ultrasound images supplied by Harborfen Diagnostic Centre.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Elias Verran recorded a small anechoic suprapatellar effusion on the images measuring approximately 7–9 mm in depth, noted intact patellar and quadriceps tendon continuity, and observed no focal Doppler hyperemia suggestive of active tendinopathy.</storyitem>
<storyitem>At 08:15 on 2025-08-30 Dr. Elias Verran performed a repeat clinical examination and documented standardized knee range-of-motion and symptom scores for Maya Cortes.</storyitem>
<storyitem>Dr. Elias Verran documented active knee extension of 0° and flexion to 135° bilaterally, a resting visual analogue pain score of 1/10 rising to 2/10 with single-leg squat provocation, and stable anterior drawer and Lachman tests with no joint-line tenderness.</storyitem>
<storyitem>At 08:35 on 2025-08-30 Dr. Elias Verran cleared Maya Cortes for match selection with an initial conservative minutes cap of 10–12 minutes.</storyitem>
<storyitem>The minutes cap was defined as total in-game time per match for the immediate fixtures, to be delivered in no more than two separate stints and with coaching instructed to minimise prolonged high-intensity defensive minutes during each appearance.</storyitem>
<storyitem>On 2025-08-30 Dr. Elias Verran instructed the Rivermark Lynx medical team to perform daily symptom checks for Maya Cortes before and after training and match activity.</storyitem>

<storyitem>The one-week functional review was booked for 09:00 on 2025-09-06 at Harborfen Diagnostic Centre and will include repeat targeted ultrasound, standardized isokinetic quadriceps/hamstring strength testing and a monitored five-minute on-court conditioning set to determine criteria for incremental minutes increases.</storyitem>
